decks.notes: This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on quickly gaining board control through a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells. The main strategy is to establish a strong presence early in the game with resilient threats like Fleecemane Lion and Hangarback Walker, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Ultimate Price and Dromoka's Command. The deck also utilizes powerful combat tricks and versatile removal options to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to apply consistent pressure and maintain board advantage to secure victory.

The main premise of this deck is to deploy powerful threats and disruption early in the game to put pressure on the opponent and control the board. By combining efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix with removal spells like Ultimate Price and Abzan Charm, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Cards like Thoughtseize and Den Protector provide additional versatility and interaction, allowing the player to adapt to different situations and outmaneuver the opponent. The inclusion of Elspeth, Sun's Champion provides a powerful finisher and additional threat against opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. By using efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix, along with versatile removal spells like Thoughtseize and Abzan Charm, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage consistently. The inclusion of cards like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Nissa, Vastwood Seer provides additional value and versatility, allowing the deck to adapt to different game scenarios. With a mix of aggressive threats and disruptive spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main idea of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using mana dorks and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, allowing for powerful plays with big creatures like Dragonlord Atarka and Genesis Hydra. The deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Whisperwood Elemental and Reclamation Sage while slowly building up to overwhelming threats. The inclusion of cards like Woodland Bellower and Nissa, Vastwood Seer provides additional value and card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to dominate the late game with huge creatures and efficient mana generation.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Elvish Mystic, in order to play high-cost powerful creatures like Dragonlord Atarka and Hornet Queen. The deck also includes control elements such as Sylvan Caryatid and Courser of Kruphix to help stabilize the board and Whisperwood Elemental to generate additional value. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while maintaining control of the game through ramp and card advantage.

Utilizing ramp creatures and mana acceleration, this deck aims to quickly play powerful green threats to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. With a focus on mana generation and card advantage, it looks to establish a strong board presence and finish off the opponent with high-impact creatures like Dragonlord Atarka. By efficiently ramping into large threats, the deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent in the late game, ultimately dominating with its powerful green creatures.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent, utilizing powerful creatures such as Dragonlord Atarka, Thunderbreak Regent, and Stormbreath Dragon. The deck also includes ramp cards like Elvish Mystic and Xenagos, the Reveler to accelerate mana and cast threats ahead of schedule. Synergies with cards like Courser of Kruphix, Den Protector, and Deathmist Raptor provide additional value and resilience. Removal spells like Draconic Roar, Roast, and Crater's Claws help control the board and clear the way for your creatures to dominate the battlefield.

The deck is focused on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing a mix of powerful dragons and efficient removal spells to apply pressure to the opponent early on. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Crackling Doom and Draconic Roar, while also utilizing powerful dragons like Thunderbreak Regent and Stormbreath Dragon to quickly close out the game. With a solid mana base and a mix of hand disruption like Thoughtseize, the deck looks to take control of the game and overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive threats.

The main concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board with efficient removal spells like Crackling Doom and Draconic Roar, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Soulfire Grand Master, Stormbreath Dragon, and Thunderbreak Regent to deal consistent damage to the opponent. By combining strong creatures with versatile removal options, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain a constant threat on the battlefield to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a mix of big creatures like Dragonlord Atarka and Polukranos, World Eater, along with mana ramp from Rattleclaw Mystic and Elvish Mystic to quickly play them. The deck also includes cards like Valorous Stance and Dromoka's Command for removal and protection, while also incorporating planeswalkers like Xenagos, the Reveler for additional threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy with a mix of lands that provide different colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively apply pressure on the opponent using a combination of powerful dragons and efficient removal spells. By using cards like Thunderbreak Regent, Stormbreath Dragon, and Goblin Rabblemaster, along with removal spells like Bile Blight and Hero's Downfall, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage to the opponent quickly. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Kolaghan's Command adds extra versatility and disruption to disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive strategy and put pressure on the opponent to keep up.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence of enchantment creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats. By utilizing cards like Sigil of the Empty Throne and Eidolon of Blossoms, the deck aims to create a constant flow of creatures while also controlling the opponent's board with removal spells like Banishing Light and Silkwrap. Additionally, the deck takes advantage of mana acceleration with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Frontier Siege to power out multiple threats in a single turn, putting pressure on the opponent early and often.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play out artifact creatures and equipment, using cards like Ensoul Artifact and Shrapnel Blast to pump up their power and deal damage. The deck aims to flood the board with threats and overwhelm the opponent while also having some control elements with Stubborn Denial and Phyrexian Revoker. The synergy between artifact creatures like Hangarback Walker and artifact equipment like Ghostfire Blade allows for a fast and powerful offense, making it difficult for opponents to keep up with the pressure.
